title: Righteous
description: The first posthumous single put out by his estate, “Righteous” is an emotional ballad for Juice WRLD fans. One day prior the release, Juice’s fiancé posted on Twitter  explaining what the song meant to her .

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I will (Will)
I will (I will)
I will
Uh (Uh)
All white Gucci suit, I'm feeling righteous, yeah
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice likens himself to some sort of religious saint; white is considered a color of holiness in many faiths, hence why he feels “righteous. The idiom is used to describe having an overflowing abundance of something; Juice has an excessive amount of codeine.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I know that the truth is hard to digest, yeah
Five or six pills in my right hand, yeah
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: I love you and im letting it be known publicly that ain’t shit fucking up the real love I found. Addiction kills all but you can overcomeJuice’s battle abruptly ended when he died due to an accidental overdose on codeine and oxycodone in December 2019.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Codeine runneth over on my nightstand
Takin' medicine to fix all of the damage
My anxiety, the size of a planet (Yeah, ooh)
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: This is not the first time Juice WRLD has used the imagery of breathing in his songs. For example, in his March 2019 track “Make Believe,”  he raps:‘Cause if you leave, I’m not breathin’I’ll show you how it feels not to breathe, breatheInhale, exhale

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Holes in my skull, over time
My heart's over ice (Woah)
Over ice, I'm freezing
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice WRLD’s lyrics might not mean what they seem here. He finds a girl’s eyes beautiful on the exterior, and only after being with her does he realize the ugliness contained within.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Beautiful eyes, deceiving
We may die this evening
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice is well aware that indulging in these druggy habits could cost him his life—as they unfortunately did—but he continues regardless, as to cope with his anxiety. It’s similar to prophetic lyrics from 2018’s “Lean Wit Me”:Will I die tonight?

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Coughing, wheezing, bleeding
High, I'm an anxious soul
Blood moons are my eyes, stay low
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Drugs like marijuana and cocaine can cause your eyes to become bloodshot or dilated respectively, hence Juice having red eyes. Juice compares the moon’s demonic color to his eyes, to allude he’s becoming one with the devil.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Red and black, they glow
Under attack, in my soul
When it's my time, I'll know
Never seen a hell so cold
Yeah, we'll make it out, I'll know
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: In most written scriptures like the Bible, Hell is known as a place where people who sin, and don’t repent, go to when they die. They have already been sent to Hell and he is confident that their love is so strong that they will make it out of this place by the sole force of their mutual feelings.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: We'll run right through the flames, let's go (Go)
All white Gucci suit, I'm feeling righteous, yeah
I know that the truth is hard to digest, yeah
Five or six pills in my right hand, yeah
Codeine runneth over on my nightstand
Taking medicine to fix all of the damage
My anxiety, the size of a planet (Yeah, ooh)
Holes in my skull, over time
My heart's over ice (Woah, uh)
I'm in too deep
Can't swim like me
We're drowning, so I will see
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Juice is struggling to stay afloat to deal with his problems and embraces this—choosing to sing, instead of resisting. Juice posthumously dedicated a song named after the ship, “Titanic,” earlier in the album.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: My demons ten feet, under me
Inhale, exhale, but I can't breathe
Too busy drinking codeine doin' high speeds
Crash, pour a four, sip it slow, make the time pass
Take a pill for the thrill, have a relapse
Devil in my head tryna run gym laps
I ain't tryna race, he don't even know me like that
All white Gucci suit, I'm feeling righteous
I know that the truth is hard to digest
Five or six pills in my right hand
Codeine runneth over on my nightstand
Taking medicine to fix all of the damage
My anxiety, the size of a planet (Yeah, ooh)
Holes in my skull, over time
My heart's over ice (Woah)
I will see
